projects.name: EA_UNFCCC_11th Umbrella_NC/BTR
projects.description: The objective of this project is to support forty-three (43) developing countries to prepare and submit BTRs and combined BTRs/NCs that comply with the UNFCCC/PA reporting requirements; and respond to their national development goals. The programme aims to support national governments fulfill essential communication requirements to the Convention and is in conformity with Objective 3 of the GEF-7 Climate Change Focal Area, which focuses on fostering enabling conditions for mainstreaming mitigati
projects.outcome: Development of policy, regulatory and incentive frameworks for an enabling environment for business supported

projects.name: EA_UNFCCC_7th Umbrella_NC/BUR
projects.description: This proposal has been prepared in response to the COP decisions for the preparation of Biennial Update Reports and National Communications by non-Annex I. The project aims to support twenty-five (25) national governments fulfill essential communication requirements to the Climate Convention and the Paris Agreement; and is in conformity with GEF-6 strategic focal area on climate change mitigation, objective 3 on fostering enabling conditions to mainstream mitigation concerns into sustainable dev
projects.outcome: Institutions and capacities for delivery of effective and responsive social protection systems strengthened

projects.name: Restoration of ecosystems, integrated natural resource management and promotion of SLM in Mbuluzi River Basin of Eswatini
projects.description: Eswatini is a landlocked country located in Southern Africa. The country is mostly bordered by the Republic of South Africa on the north, west and partly southeast. Towards the east, the country borders the Republic of Mozambique. Its approximate land area is 17,364 km2, lying between latitudes 25° 43' S and 27° 19' S and longitudes 30° 47' E and 32° 08' E. projects.name: Africa Minigrids Programme
projects.description:
The UNDP-supported, GEF-financed Africa Minigrids Program (AMP) aims to support African countries, including Eswatini, to increase energy access by reducing the cost and increasing commercial viability of renewable energy (RE) minigrids. 
For Eswatini, the AMP focus is on establishing a springboard for RE minigrid development, building data and knowledge resources and ‘proof of concept’ business models that can inform planning, de-risk investments and encourage private sector participation in th

projects.name: Strengthening national-level institutional and professional capacities of country Parties towards enhanced UNCCD monitoring and reporting – GEF 7 EA
projects.description: The international community through the UN member states adopted, in September 2015, the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development with 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Among these SDGs, Goal 15 is particularly relevant for the United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification (UNCCD). Through this goal, countries are urged to, Protect, restore and promote sustainable use of terrestrial ecosystems, sustainably manage forests, combat desertification, and halt and reverse land degradation
projects.outcome: National and sub-national institutions capacities to sustainably manage natural resources justify and benefit the most vulnerable and marginalized communities strengthened
